message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.GR, cs.SY, cs.SC 

The paper deals with efficient algorithms for computing Minkowski sums of convex polyhedra in 3D, which is a fundamental problem in computational geometry. The algorithms are based on arrangements of curves on surfaces in 3D, which is a classical topic in computational geometry and falls under the category of computational geometry (cs.CG). The paper also presents software components for handling these arrangements, which involves data structures and algorithms for manipulating them, and this falls under the category of data structures (cs.DS) and graph theory (cs.GR). The paper also discusses applications of these arrangements to other problems, such as partitioning an assembly of polyhedra in 3D, which falls under the category of control theory (cs.SY) and scientific computing (cs.SC). Overall, the paper covers a wide range of topics in computational geometry and related fields, and is likely to be relevant to researchers in several sub-disciplines of computer science.
